alert.note: Alert for Apache; Navajo (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 14 at 4:52PM MST until August 14 at 8:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Navajo County east of Holbrook in north central Arizona... Apache County in northeastern Arizona... * Until 800 PM MST. * At 450 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain in the Puerco and Dry Wash basins east of Holbrook. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Petrified Forest National Park. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between mile markers 298 and 309. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Ninemile Wash, Beaver Dam Wash, Milky Wash, Puerco River, Wild Cow Wash, East Twin Wash, Little Lithodendron Wash, Lithodendron Wash, Carr Lake Draw, Wildhorse Wash and Jim Camp Wash. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly or mountainous terrain, there are many low water crossings which will become dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
